head.title: Arts, Briefly; Pittsburgh Symphony Taps Slatkin

hedline.hl1: Arts, Briefly; Pittsburgh Symphony Taps Slatkin

body.head.byline: By DANIEL J. WAKIN; Compiled by Lawrence Van Gelder

block.p: Leonard Slatkin, below, who finishes his tenure as music director of the National Symphony Orchestra in Washington next season, was appointed yesterday as the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra's principal guest conductor, effective September 2008. The Pittsburgh Symphony said he would spend at least three weeks with the orchestra each season across his three-year contract. The orchestra's new music director, Manfred Honeck, takes over in September 2008. The orchestra also announced yearly relationships for the next three seasons with the composers John Corigliano, John Adams and Richard Danielpour.
